title: 5 Reasons to get cranked up about Cotton Ginning Days
text:
Posted Oct. 5, 2015 at 4:45 PM By Staff Reports Posted Oct. 5, 2015 at 4:45 PM HOURS 10 a.m.–5 p.m. Friday; 9 a.m.-5 .pm. Saturday; and 10 a.m.-5 p.m. (Church Service 9 a.m.) » Read more X HOURS 
10 a.m.–5 p.m. Friday; 9 a.m.-5 .pm. Saturday; and 10 a.m.-5 p.m. (Church Service 9 a.m.) The 28th Annual Cotton Ginning Days Festival – celebrating Gaston County’s textile heritage – returns this weekend to Gaston County Park, 1303 Dallas-Cherryville Highway, Dallas. 1. The cotton gin will be in full operation all weekend long, and members of the Gaston Agricultural, Mechanical and Textile Restoration Association will showcase many different restored steam and gasoline engines. 2. The Heritage Arts Village will showcase a blacksmith, pottery, soap and candle making, along with many more demonstrations. There will be more than 75 artisans selling handmade arts and crafts plus 20 food vendors. 3. The two stages on Saturday will highlight traditional bluegrass and contemporary bluegrass music featuring the female trio Underhill Rose, The Band Concord, Carolina Blue, The Cockman Family, The Flowers Family and The Griggs. 4. The Kid’s County Fair will have mechanical rides, bounce house obstacle courses and carnival games. The hours for rides will be Friday from 5-10 p.m., Saturday 9 a.m.-5 p.m., and Sunday from noon-5 p.m. 5. Admission and parking are free and a free shuttle will run from Gaston College to the Festival on Saturday. WANT MORE INFORMATION? Contact Gaston County Parks and Recreation at 704-922-2160 or visit the www.GastonGov.com By Staff Reports
